newsitem.title: CROATIA: Ivana Trump to invest in Croatian tourism.
newsitem.headline: Ivana Trump to invest in Croatian tourism.

text.p: Ivana Trump, Czech-born former wife of American billionaire property tycoon Donald Trump, plans to pour money into the Croatian tourism industry, she said on a weekend visit to the Adriatic coast.
"Croatia has a vast tourist potential," Trump was quoted in Sunday's Vjesnik newspaper as telling local leaders and tourist board representatives in the ancient walled city of Dubrovnik.
"The motive for my visit to Dubrovnik is strictly business. I am interested in investing in hotels, casinos, restaurants or night clubs," said Trump.

Croatia boasts a long, scenic coastline scattered with wooded islands but infrastructure is run-down. Tourism slumped in 1991 when war broke out in former Yugoslavia and many hotels on the coast were used to house refugees.
Trump planned to visit the island of Rab on Sunday and said the trip would be "strictly business".

The 48-year-old former fashion model and Olympic skier received more than $50 million in a bitter divorce settlement from Donald Trump in 1990 after his highly publicised affair with former beauty contestant Marla Maples.
